Docs.summary: Represents a column of cells that contain links in a control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkColumn> class is a specialized type of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn> class used to logically host cells that respond to user clicks. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkColumn> class is similar to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewButtonColumn> class but provides a different user experience that may be more appropriate in certain situations, such as displaying a URL stored in a database table.
To display the same link text for every cell, set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkColumn.UseColumnTextForLinkValue%2A> property to `true` and set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkColumn.Text%2A> property to the desired link text.
A <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkColumn> has an associated <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkCell> in every <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow> that intersects it.
The default sort mode for this column type is <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnSortMode.NotSortable>.
To respond to user link clicks, handle the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellContentClick?displayProperty=fullName> event. You can also use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellClick?displayProperty=fullName> event to respond to clicks anywhere in the cell.

## Remarks The constructor for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkColumn> class initializes this property to a newly created <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkCell>.
> [!CAUTION] > Changing the properties of the cell template will not immediately affect the user interface (UI) of the column's existing cells.
